author: Elizabeth Winkler
title: Don’t Be Fooled by Tiffany’s Slowdown
text:
If Holly Golightly were to drop by a Tiffany store to see the diamonds, she might be surprised, and pleasantly so. The luxury jeweler has struggled with years of declining sales but new products, including a home-goods collection featuring items like $350 gold crazy straws and $9,000 sterling silver balls of yarn, are clicking with customers.
In January, the company reported that its world-wide same-store sales for the holiday season increased 5%. That got investors and analysts excited. Then growth slowed in January, leading... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
